dc.title: One Talk on Verses from Nagarjuna's Sixty Verses on Reasoning & One Talk on Direct Valid Cognition
dc.creator: Khenpo Tsultrim Gyamtso Rinpoche

marpa_core.description: This xml is loosely imitating PBCore as a placeholder until we implement support for real PBCore XML
This xml is loosely imitating PBCore as a placeholder until we implement support for real PBCore XML
This xml is loosely imitating PBCore as a placeholder until we implement support for real PBCore XML
marpa_core.annotation: EMC:
This tape has 2 talks.
I wonder if this location is correct as Boudha. From comments Rinpoche makes, I wonder if it isn't Bodh Gaya. Need to ask Peter.
Talk One

The translator (Kiki Ekselius) is only recorded until 3:14, which is the introduction to the teaching. After that, Kiki is not recorded except for her translation of the root verse @ 12:23-13:34 and partially at 15:46 (probably mistakenly).

This is a teaching on verses 26-27 in Nagarjuna's Sixty Verses on Reasoning (Yuktiṣhaṣhṭikākārikā, Rigs pa drug cu pa’i tshig le’ur byas pa) Toh. 3825, which Rinpoche says describe the nature of samsara.
Tibetan:
gnas med dmigs pa yod ma yin
rtsa ba med cing gnas pa med
ma righ rgyu las shin tu byung
thog ma dbus mtha' rnam spangs
chu zhing bzhin du snying po med
dri za'i grong khyer 'dra ba ste
rmongs pa'i grong khyer mi bzad pa'i
'gro ba sgyu ma bzhin du snang
smon lam (aspiration) and dedication start at 23:48.
Talk Two
begins at 24:56
Subject: mngon sum tshad ma.
Notes: someone should listen more carefully to the content and note what verses/text Rinpoche is using.
No recording of the translator (Kiki Ekselius).
ends at 56:29
Sound quality is fine throughout for both talks. No empty spaces and seems not to miss anything of Rinpoche.
These 2 talks should not be listed as having translation. They are only suitable for those who know Tibetan.
